result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ryan Michael Sullivan

records.addlTxt:
10:16 AM Defendant Ryan Michael Sullivan appeared by video.  Attorney Scott Harold Southworth appeared by video for Ryan Michael Sullivan.  Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Southworth states that he and the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading. Atty Southworth waives time limits for the Prelim.  Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands and agrees with the waiver.

BY THE COURT:  Defendant waives time limits for the preliminary hearing. 
bond continued
Status hearing scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Status hearing on November 22, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Petition for Leave to File Additional Motions

Adjustment Number: 22A 002254,
Payable Number: 75494,
Receipt Number: 22R 003553,
Amount: $20.00

*Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no possession or consumption of any alcohol  *No contact with Victim 1 or Victim 2 or their residence  *Defendant is allowed to go to residence one time with Law Enforcement with prior notice to the victim, to get his belongings.  *Provide PBT to any law enforcement official if they have reasonable suspicion that he has been consuming alcohol

3:22 PM Defendant Ryan Michael Sullivan appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant received complaint. Court advises defendant of the maximum penalties. Court confirms address and phone. Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands.  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause for Riverside purposes.
Atty Burdon requests $1,000 signature bond with conditions.  Defendant makes statement.  BY THE COURT:  Court sets $1,000.00 signature bond with conditions.
Initial appearance scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on October 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.
